intro: Steudelia sylvatica, commonly known as the woodland star, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded woodland habitats. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. Steudelia sylvatica is often found in rich, loamy soils and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
